The Federal Government has announced it wants to shake up how HECS debts are indexed. What does this mean? Currently, around 3 million Australians have student loans, with the average debt sitting at $26,500. The proposed measure is set to reduce each student's outstanding HECS/HELP debt by approximately $1,200 this year. What are the proposed changes? The upcoming Federal Budget will introduce a significant reform to HECS and HELP loans to prevent student debts from outpacing wage growth. The reform proposes capping the indexation rate of these loans to the lower of the Consumer Price Index (CPI) or the Wage Price Index (WPI). Pending legislative approval, this change would be applied retroactively from June 1, 2023, reversing last yearâ€™s indexation rate of 7.1%. This ensures a fairer and more sustainable approach to managing student debt. Will the proposed changes become law? We'll know more once the Federal Budget is handed down on the 14th May 2024. #Studentdebt #university #HECSdebt #education
